text: Laxmannia squarrosa is a species of Laxmannia, a genus of tufted perennial herbs in the family Asparagaceae, subfamily Lomandroideae, which is endemic to Western Australia. From 0.03-0.1 m high, it grows on gravel and lateritic sand, and its white flowers may be seen from September to November. ==References== squarrosa Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia Category:Taxa named by John Lindley Category:Plants described in 1840
title: Laxmannia squarrosa
